newsitem.title: USA: USDA to allow grazing on some CRP land -- senator.
newsitem.headline: USDA to allow grazing on some CRP land -- senator.

text.p: The U.S. Agriculture Department will allow farmers suffering the effects of bad weather to use Conservation Reserve (CRP) land for haying and grazing, U.S. Senator Tom Harkin said on Tuesday.
"The action should provide some much-needed relief to livestock producers short on forage because of adverse weather," the Iowa Democrat said in a statement.

Harkin said USDA informed him that it would issue guidelines allowing use of CRP land in approved counties. To qualify for access, there must have been at least a 40-percent loss in hay and pasture production, he said.
Producers suffering loss of alfalfa in northern Iowa dueto winter kill would be included, he said.
